faqs.question: When should I visit an orthopedic doctor for pain?
faqs.answer: If pain persists more than a week or limits daily activities, book a consultation for diagnosis.

faqs.question: Can long-term knee pain be cured?
faqs.answer: Many knee problems respond well to targeted treatment and physiotherapy; some degenerative conditions are managed to reduce symptoms.

faqs.question: Is back pain due to posture treatable?

faqs.question: Do you treat senior citizens & arthritis patients?
faqs.answer: Yes. We offer tailored treatment plans for older patients focused on safety and function.

faqs.question: Can I avoid surgery with early treatment?
faqs.answer: Many conditions can be treated conservatively if identified early; surgery is recommended only when necessary.

faqs.question: Do you offer emergency fracture treatment?
faqs.answer: We provide initial fracture care and immobilization; complex cases are referred to specialist centres when required.
